0:
```json
{
    "Model_Purpose": {
        "full_description": "The purpose of this model is to understand the impact of elites in the spread of norms as an extension of a previous model. This model is founded predominantly on norm diffusion theory, designed to test assumptions of norm diffusion theories in an environment where peer pressure is the only mechanism for punishment-based enforcement of norm adoption. The current model aims to explore how norms diffuse before they become institutionalized through penalties, focusing on humanitarian norms as conventions that do not rely on punishment for adoption.",
        "research_questions": [
            "How do networked elites influence the diffusion of a non-punishment-enforced norm through an artificial society?",
            "What role do norm advocates play in promoting humanitarian norms to elites and the general population?",
            "How does peer pressure function as a mechanism for norm adoption among general agents?"
        ],
        "system_boundaries": [],
        "outcome_variables": {
            "percent_elites": "Percentage of population who are elites (influencers)",
            "advocate_weight_e": "Weight advocate exerts on the elite agent’s humanitarianism values",
            "peer_weight_e": "Weight placed on interactions with other elite agents",
            "network_size": "Randomized size of network of 'followers' of elites",
            "advocate_weight_g": "Weight the advocate exerts on general agents",
            "elite_weight": "Weight given to a networked elite’s norm adoption",
            "general_weight": "Weight given to a one-on-one interaction with a general agent",
            "peer_weight_g": "Weight given to average humanitarian values of a group of nearby agents",
            "percent_advocates": "Percentage of agent population who are advocates promoting a norm",
            "advocate_zeal": "Homogeneous value given to advocate agents’ humanitarianism values",
            "degrade_percent": "Amount per time step that an agent degrades its humanitarianism values, representing donor/compassion fatigue",
            "mu_activist_state": "Mean humanitarianism value of all general agents",
            "mu_activist_threshold": "Mean threshold value of all general agents beyond which they become active humanitarian actors",
            "Population": "Total population of agents"
        }
    }
}
```

            "How do humanitarian norms that lack associated punishments for non-compliance diffuse across society?",

        ],

            "The model is grounded in political science norm diffusion theory and focuses on humanitarian norms as conventions without punishment mechanisms.",
            "The simulation runs for 200-time steps, which is the point by which nearly all simulations converge to a stable number of norm adopters."
        ],
        "outcome_variables": {
            "percent_elites": "Percentage of population who are elites (influencers).",
            "advocate_weight_e": "Weight advocate exerts on the elite agent’s humanitarianism values.",
            "peer_weight_e": "Weight placed on interactions with other elite agents.",
            "network_size": "Randomized size of network of ‘followers’ of elites.",

        }
    }
}

The model focuses on norm diffusion theories in an environment where peer pressure is the primary mechanism for norm adoption.             "The model does not currently include the internalization and institutionalization stages of norms.",

            "The model does not account for competition between elites for prestige and utility maximization."
        ],
        "outcome_variables": {
            "percent_elites": "Percentage of population who are elites (influencers).",
            "advocate_weight_e": "Weight advocate exerts on the elite agent’s humanitarianism values.",
            "peer_weight_e": "Weight placed on interactions with other elite agents.",
            "network_size": "Randomized size of network of ‘followers’ of elites.",
            "advocate_weight_g": "Weight the advocate exerts on general agents.",
            "elite_weight": "Weight given to a networked elite’s norm adoption.",
            "general_weight": "Weight given to a one-on-one interaction with a general agent.",
            "peer_weight_g": "Weight given to average humanitarian values of a group of nearby agents.",
            "percent_advocates": "Percentage of agent population who are advocates who promote a norm.",
            "advocate_zeal": "Homogeneous value given to advocate agents’ humanitarianism values.",
            "degrade_percent": "Amount per time step that an agent degrades its humanitarianism values, representing donor/compassion fatigue."
        }
    }
}
